productDescription: Hamilton Beach Custom Grind Coffee Grinders are ideal for precision coffee grinding, giving you the exact texture you want every time. Well-defined fineness settings guarantee perfect results and clear cup markings ensure meticulous measuring.

A Hamilton Beach Coffee Grinder is easy to use and clean. They offer hands-free operation with auto shutoff as well as hide-away cords for easy storage. Some coffee bean grinders even include a stainless steel grinding chamber that comes out for easy cleanup in the dishwasher.

reviews.reviewText:
I’ve had it for about a week, I’ve used it every morning since I got it. I’m totally happy with it. It says it’s a lot quieter than other brands, I’d believe that it is. Obviously it’s not silent but it’s probably 1/3 as loud as an average blender, so it’s decent. It’s quick and easy to use, put your beans in, put the cap on, push the button a few times to grind em up, maybe one longer burst to really get them ground.

Things you should know/other people’s complaints:

Someone said that it’s “no good, it leaves chunks of beans”. This doesn’t happen to me, but my guess is that they’re not grinding the beans enough or they’re somehow over filling it. While grinding you can tip it upside down in between bursts of the motor to mix it around better.

“It makes a mess, coffee grounds everywhere!” The cap is a cup. When your coffee beans (or spices) are fully ground, tip it upside down and pull the machine out of the cap, and you won’t spill anything.

“The motor burnt out after just a few uses” so obvisouly I haven’t had this for more than a week so I can’t yet say it should last forever. It probably won’t, but for $15 if I have to buy a new one every year or two, I can live with that. It could’ve also just been a faulty unit... stuff happens. BUT basically don’t just hold down the button so the motor and blades spin continuously. In stead to short bursts like you’re revving a motorcycle... this will break the big pieces into smaller pieces, and shoot them around and mix them up so the blades aren’t working so hard. Then after a few bursts when it’s mostly ground up, you can hold it a bit longer to make sure there aren’t chunks left. I like my coffee a little coarse (its definitely not espresso ground... see photos).

“The cord is too short”... yeah the bottom is also a cap that pulls straight down and then you can unwrap the power cable. Though, even unspooled, the cord is pretty short... it’s the only thing I don’t like about this device... it can only be about a foot from an outlet. I deal with it, but it’s the one thing I would change about it.

For a cheap, tabletop grinder I don’t see how it could be beat. It’s pretty easy to clean (the top washes just like a cup, and the part where the beans sit on the blades pulls out like a cup as well). It works great and I’m totally satisfied for what it is.

reviews.reviewTitle: Solid little coffee grinder. I recommend.
reviews.reviewText:
Update. The fact that the bin is so hard to pull out has cost me much frustration. I am updating to two stars, from four. I've spilled so much coffee, that I am thinking of trashing this thing.

Pros and cons:

Pros.

Cheap.
Easy to use.
Easy to clean (dishwasher friendly)
Grinds to a VERY FINE point, nearly dust. Love it.
Can also stop grinding earlier if you want to make it not quite so fine.
Cord hides inside the machine.

Cons.
Cord is short.
A bit small. Need to load and grind twice for a sufficient quantity of coffee, but I like mine strong, so that may be subjective.
The interior does not come out of the machine that easily; you have to pull on it. Pull on it too hard, and it'll come out, but your coffee dust will go all over your face. So you have to do it slow, or you have to flip the entire machine over and give it a love tap on the bottom to get the coffee out.

Do I recommend this machine? Heck yes. Its cheap as heck, it'll last forever, and really, how much do you want to pay for a dang coffee grinder?

I bought this item a few weeks ago and wanted to give it at least a dozen uses before reviewing. That being said, I can't yet say that this item stands the test of time. On top of that, I use this not to grind up coffee beans, but for other things. I bought this item to make powders, such as dried pepper powders, dried mushroom powders and the like.

PROS: given that I'm using this for purposes not intended by the manufacturer, it's doing a good job. I like how fine my end product is.

It's cheap! Even if it worked 75% as good as it does, I would say this is a steal.

I love how the grinder compartment comes apart, and despite recommendations against, I still hand wash the detachable parts and let air dry for a good day. I still hand clean the main part with a dry or very light damp paper, sit it upside down and and let it dry a good day. No problems here, but again, the manufacturer (and pretty much everyone else) advises against this. I'm just lazy, and the subsequent powder gets everywhere, which leads me to the cons.

CONS: this thing does a great job grinding up stuff, but it often results in a powdery smoke afterwards, which often escapes while grinding. This smoke gets everywhere including into the mechanics of the grinder. I'm hoping this doesn't cause issues down the road. Additionally, if you're like me and using this for other than coffee purposes, get a cheap face mask, especially when grinding hot peppers.

The mechanism that spins the grinding blades doesn't always fit snugly and when I was first using this, it gave off a plastic burn smell. It's gone away after 6 uses or so, but it was initially concerning.

That's the big summation. Despite the few issues, this item warrants a 5 star, if nothing else, because it does more than just expected and is very cost effective. If this lasts 6 months with my usage (grinding all sorts of dried things 2 times a week) then I will have made out.

reviews.reviewTitle: I loved this coffee grinder but this morning it mysteriously quit ...
reviews.reviewText: I loved this coffee grinder but this morning it mysteriously quit on me. It worked great for approximately a month and a half and just quit. It wasn't dropped or mishandled in any way. My husband has an ohm meter that he checked it with and without opening it up thinks a wire or the motor just burned out possibly. Too late to send it back so I will choose another of a different brand and hope for better luck. I think I will get a manual grind the next time. Less to go wrong with it. It was great while it lasted though.

This is perfect for fine grinding and I like that the whole cup removes & can be washed out. I must not have read the description right, as I thought it had a "retractable" cord - when it actually just winds around the bottom - but you pull the bottom down to unwind it and rewind it, thus most of the cord is concealed when not in use. It turns flax seed into dust in seconds (perfect for making Gundry's cinnamon/flaxseed muffin in a mug)! A great little grinder at a great price! Highly recommend!

The cord length is perfect and I love that it can be folded up so easily. I wish all appliances had this function.

The way I use this is to put a small amount of beans in at a time. Quick bursts/pulses to blend it. Repeat.

It blends better with less beans and with the short quick bursts rather than holding it down. I love using this. It’s allowed me to grind my coffee every single morning. So fresh! Very easy to clean and store. Can’t beat it, especially for the price.

I bought this grinder mainly for spices. It does that job extremely well and the clean up afterwards is nice and quick. If you are looking for a quaility product that doesn't break the bank, this is it.

reviews.reviewTitle: UPDATED 11-2019: Love Everything About It - Very easy to use grinder
reviews.reviewText:
UPDATE: 11-2019 -- FYI: Still going strong. Works great, easy to clean. Very good value.

Much, much better design that Mr. Coffee because it has a better balance (the Mr. Coffee one easily tipped over). The cap is very easy to fill with beans, the on switch very easy to use, does a great job of grinding, and it is very easy to brush the remaining coffee out. This is also very easy to clean.

I think one of the reasons why this grinder is so easy to use is because the parts are so accessible, and easy to hold in your hand. In comparison, the Mr. Coffee grinder didn't fit well in your hand, and the parts weren't spaced well.

I have been using this grinder for about 10 months now without a problem. I love it.

I really wanted to like this product. First off as other reviews imply its a super simple push one button grinder. Im great with that especially because my partner cant deal w fancy or complicated. The huge problem: the grounds spill everywhere because the compartment isnt secure or big enough enough to hold the grounds. So if you lift up the top to get the coffee you just freshly grounded, they go everywhere.

I had a hamilton beach coffee grinder for years that I loved. I dropped it and broke the cover and switch. In my coffee deprived stupor I quickly ordered another hamilton beach coffee grinder here on amazon. The previous grinder was a gift so I don't know what it cost. I figured this particular one would be equivalent. Unfortunately, the lid doesn't "lock" on like my previous one so I've dumped coffee several times trying to pick the grinder up by the top. I also don't like the manual cord wrap around - it's too much trouble so I never use it and the cord dangles - but that's just me being lazy. The previous hamilton beach had settings for how many cups you were grinding and what consistency you wanted the beans ground up. This particular grinder has one setting and that's it. Also, the previous grinder had a fairly large capacity space for coffee beans. This one barely holds 5 tbsps of coffee beans and w/ a 12 cup coffee brewer I want 6 tbsps of coffee beans so I'm constantly "stacking" the beans up and trying to get the lid on quickly before spilling beans every where. But again, that's my personal preference. This grinder does a good job of grinding and is quieter than the previous one. I don't wake up the other people in the house and make the dogs bark when I use this one. I've also used it to grind spices and it does a very nice job w/ that. So, the only reason I'm giving it four stars instead of five is because I think it's needs a locking lid, a larger capacity, and a better way to wrap the cord up. Otherwise, it's done a fine job of keeping me in caffeine every morning.

reviews.reviewTitle: Still going strong after over a years use in a frat house
reviews.reviewText:
It's been over a year since I bought it, and it's worked just as good as the first time I used it. It looks and feels a bit cheap, but its held up great. The only downside is a kinda short power cable, but its nothing that I've had any troubles with.

I've been prepared to spend a bit more money to get a better grinder once this one breaks, but it's not looking like that's going to happen anytime soon.

I have a small area at the end of my kitchen countertop that I've made into a sort of mini coffee bar, with a lazy susan holding all of my coffee supplies. This very compact little grinder is the perfect size for this. Even the cord wraps around a little space at the bottom and then is covered by pushing up on the bottom, so only the end hangs out while not in use. The blades work great, and it only takes seconds to grind enough coffee for about 8-10 cups. That's about the max amount of beans you can fit at one time. A quick clean up is very easy with just a damp paper towel, but the clear middle blade section and the clear dome top both separate easily to clean more thoroughly. This is my first coffee grinder and I love it. I plan to buy a couple more for family members as gifts. The coffee just tastes so much fresher and better. (Measure a little more fresh-ground coffee out than you would with the pre-ground, as fresh-ground doesn't have all the fillers, and comes out sort of 'fluffier', or less dense than the pre-ground).
broke after one week. made sound but had that 'something on fire' smell. had to return it

reviews.reviewTitle: Good grinder and easy to clean
reviews.reviewText: I have used this grinder for several months now. At first, some grounds would spill into body below the cup. However after using it awhile I no longer have the issue. The cup fits nicely in the grinder with just a delicate twist until it's locked in place. It is not heavy or noisy and definitely not a shrill or unpleasant sound. You do have to hold down the button, but I hold the grinder in both hands and use my thumb - not a problem if you have worries about pressing a button. It takes 20 seconds to a fine grind with 2 Tb coffee beans. It is easy to clean as you only have to wipe out the cup, then drop it back into the grinder and give it the slight twist. Overall it's a very good value and I'm happy with it. My former Hamilton Beach grinder lasted for years with daily use, so I looked for another HB.

reviews.reviewTitle: more quiet than orher brands, if that is a factor you're considering
reviews.reviewText: I do like the Krups brand a lot. But this one is quieter, and once the beans are ground, they don't stick to the grinder and need to be unstuck, like some bean grinder brands tend to do. I'd definitely buy this brand again ( hopefully I won't need to for a while; haha, one of our cats has a thing about knocking coffee bean grinders off the counter. Ummmm, we've learned to put out out of his range. This is our fourth purchase because of his "obsession" - first time trying Hamilton Beach. Really happy with it...). It accommodates about 7 cups before it appears a little full, but we never brew more than that amount anyway. Excellent - great price.

Worst product ever. Gives "Hamilton" a bad name. Every time I start it up the blade randomly stops spinning. I then have to take the partially-ground coffee beans out, adjust it (its not clear what does the trick- I just move things around at random), "dry fire" it, and then try and put the beans back in again. This adds unnecessary time to my already packed morning routine. Save yourself the time, and fourteen bucks, and buy something that works.

I was skeptical about buying a coffee grinder online seeing so many negative reviews but I went for this Hamilton one. I have been thoroughly impressed. We use this in my office almost daily and the grinder keeps grinding without issue. Super quiet, quick, and efficient. My only qualm is that it is difficult to deep clean. Otherwise, great product.

Had to replace my ancient noisy Karups when I tried one of these at a friend's house. So quiet. The one I got starts out smooth and quiet and then picks up a vibration/hum like a bearing going south. Can't quite say it's faulty, so I'll assume it's not a problem and change my review if it croaks.

Beyond that, the lid needs to go on just right and finding the alignment on the black on black can get dodgy. I put a little cheat line on the back in silver sharpie. Big bonus.
Size is similar to most which in my opinion is too damn small. Takes two batches to make a pot. But seems it's the industry standard for a stand alone. Good enough for my purposes.

The performance is great though. Really lets you pound those beans to a dust if you need. Highly recommended as long as the hum doesn't become a failure.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good grinder for the the price
reviews.reviewText:
So this is an inexpensive coffee grinder. I cannot review it like it is anything but that. For what it is, it works well. It grinds coffee beans. Period. And it does it well enough to provide coffee grounds I can then put into my Kuerig machine and get a really great cup of coffee.

So when using it, it helps to first use it in bursts to break down the beans. Then running it longer to get the coarse grounds into a diner consistency. One thing this grinder does not have is another compartment to store the grounds. So you have to make what you are going to use, or store them somewhere else. Generally when grinding coffee beans you want to grind them when you are going to use them anyway.

The other little annoyance is that removing the grounds is a little tricky because they get caught under the blade. No biggie at this price point.

I am happy with this product.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great Value for a Basic Grinder
reviews.reviewText:
Extremely fast and easy to use and clean. I chose this unit because the hopper (grinding chamber) and lid are removable and dishwasher safe. Easy to remove, very much like a little blender. Built in cord storage with cover is very handy. Cord isn't retractable; you have to pop off the cover, wind the cord around the center, and replace the cover. Very basic but hardworking small appliance.
Processes up to 6 Tablespoons of coffee, or up to 3 T. of spices. I use it to grind peppercorns; works great for that. There's no adjustment for how fine your result will be; that's controlled by how long you grind. If you like a specific grind, this could take a little practice. Smaller amounts take less time to reach desired fineness, so I find it best to "pulse" the grinder to get to that point. All in all, a great value for a basic coffee/spice grinder at this price.

This is my first coffee grinder so I didn't want to spend ay money--and it is only $15 so it's not a huge loss but I like my coffee strong and for two people filling this unit to the max with beans produces a watery brew. I have found that I must fill the unit to the max two times in order to make the coffee strong enough for my husband and I to drink. I wish the chamber was larger. Other than that, it's easy to lean and very small so if space is an issue this will fit the bill.

reviews.reviewTitle: I use it for grinding seasonings and spices
reviews.reviewText:
I haven't used it a ton, but I wanted it on hand. I don't drink coffee so this won't be about that. I have used it to grind up things like fennel and mustard seeds. I was making chickpea flour in my food processor and it couldn't finish the job, but this little guy did! I had to do it in small batches, but it took the clumpy mess of dried chickpea pieces and made it into flour. The sound for me is not too bad. I ran it while my toddler slept in the other room and he didn't budge.

The cord comes wrapped up in a little base on the bottom that slides down. It's nice, but not a big deal for me.
The pieces come off nicely for cleaning or when you need to dump out whatever you ground up.
Cleaning it isn't the easiest, but not crazy hard either. You can't take out the blade... I think LOL But I have been soaking the blade part for a minute then rinsing well.

So, it is great for making things into fine powders. I love that I can buy the seed version of seasonings and not have to run out for ground versions. I think this was a smart purchase.

I have had this a little over a week now and I really love it! I grind for a few seconds, shake it around to make sure the beans are evenly ground and grind again. If you only run this for a few seconds at a time, you can have some control over how fine your beans are ground. I did toss in a bit of coconut for coconut coffee and it came out great. My coffee no longer taste like cheap sludge and I am able to buy beans (from my favorite local coffee shop), run them in this grinder, put a scoop in my reusable K-cup and have a nice, bold, more environmentally friendly cup of coffee. Plus, it is way cheaper to buy these things in the long run than to buy premise k-cups. I will say, they grinder portion is a bit harder to clean to keep it from getting some water in it but it’s not enough to deter me from buying it again.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good value but older model was much better for 2 reasons
reviews.reviewText: I owned the older version of this which had two things that made it superior to this model. It could hold a little bit more coffee beans so you could grind a little more coffee which was perfect for the standard (not miniature) french press. Also, the older model had several grind timer settings much like a toaster. This one you have to hold down manually which leads to inconsistent grinds.

reviews.reviewTitle: Better than the more expensive option
reviews.reviewText:
I bought a different one for nearly twice the price, lost it in a move. Bought this expecting it might be a little less quality, but it's better. it's WAY quieter. obviously it makes some noise... but i get up a couple hours earlier than my wife, and i would always have to take my grinder into the laundry room every morning so i wouldnt wake her up. now i dont have to!

it grinds very evenly too, sometimes my old one would still have chunks of coffee bean after getting to the consistency i wanted. that doesnt happen with this one.

Have 2 of these, had the coffee one for years and for a cheap grinder it still works perfectly. Cheap is price point, not quality of the device. I use the second one for dried spices when cooking or making rubs for the smoker.

reviews.reviewTitle: Does it's job but overheats after several loads.
reviews.reviewText: My wife and I consume a lot of coffee, so I fill this up between 3-4 every weekend to grind coffee for the week. After grinding about two round I have to give it a break otherwise there is an electrical smell (i.e. the motor overworking). If you grind a lot of coffee, I'd recommend buying one with a larger coppacity.

I read the reviews before purchasing and noticed the advertised "retractable cord" is just a removable base with a cord wrapped around it for storage.
Hasn't pooped out on me yet

I like how easy it is to use. I think the hidden cord at the base it pretty cute.

If you need to grind a LOT of coffee (like a family), you might want a more industrial grinder. But for just me and my little french press in the morning, it's perfect. It doesn't have different ground settings, but I've honestly not found that to be a problem. Just "pulse" it and it's more coarse.

I love how easy it is to remove and rinse out.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not sure I received a new unit
reviews.reviewText:
First impression when opening the package: the box looked a little beat up and like it had been opened and then repackaged before coming to me. The coffee grinder itself looked good.

I'm new to grinding my own coffee, so I didn't have a good idea of how many coffee beans would yield a suitable amount of ground coffee. Now that I've put this to use, I'm disappointed at the capacity. This requires two cycles of fill with beans then grind to yield enough for a single pot of drip coffee.

Bought this so my hubby could grind up some blue mountain coffee we picked up on a vacation to Jamaica. He is in heaven! I also love it because it grinds my spices really well and it was a great price!

I purchased this for Mom. She is very pleased with the simplicity of this model. All you need to do is pour the beans into the cup, secure the cap and press the button to grind. The longer you hold the button down the finer the coffee grounds will be. You choose - short for course to brew french press style coffee or hold it down for fine grounds to make a delicious cappuccino. Works great for grinding whole spices as well. The best thing is the removal grinding cup for easy cleaning. 5 stars!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great when using conjunction with Amazon’s food dehydrator?
reviews.reviewText: This works great for coffee but I have found an unconventional way to use this device. and use it in conjunction with the cheapest food dehydrator that Amazon sells. together these two devices are great for making toppings. example dehydrated banana chips..... converted into banana powder? it works fantastically! dehydrated strawberries can be used for the same thing.

I wake up at 6am every day and it's essential to have relatively quiet grinder while making my morning coffee. This item meet expectations and is very convenient in general. Using it every day for a month already, impressions are very good, for this price it's totally awesome, great addition to my coffee shelf

reviews.reviewTitle: I thought it would hold more beans...
reviews.reviewText: I love the minimal noise with this grinder and the fact that the inside cup actually comes out for easy rinsing. I hate that this only holds 3-4 scoops of coffee beans at a time so we have to grind our beans in two different batches. If it had a larger capacity it would be perfect. When I first started using it I was not aware that the lid is actually used once you grind the beans. Flip the grinder upside down and your grounds will be contained in the lid for easy transfer from the grinder to the coffee pot.

reviews.reviewTitle: Received something completely different AND ITS BROKE
reviews.reviewText: Received a completely different grinder that is broke and does not even turn on!!!! literally it smells like its been used before because it has a coffee smell to it and has stains on it! Absolutely rediculous. Does that picture look anything like the grinder I received? Nope. The manual and grinder is a completely different model. DO NOT BUY

I used this as a spice grinder which means I used it less regularly. But, I have had one of this since 2012 and just threw it out when the plastic finally cracked. I used it for 6 years without any issues. So, without researching what other options are out there, I simply ordered this one again.

I started getting into coffee. I noticed my coffee looked watery after using my coffee maker regardless of how much I put. So I bought this to see if a finer grind helped. It did. It's not loud at all and grinds very quickly. If you hold the button continuously, you can smell the motor, so I use it in short 2 second bursts. I shake it a bit too to get a more even grind. Overall, I'm pretty happy with this. I use it about every other day.

I’d rate this item an 8 out of ten. I shook it really hard to get the water off of it after rinsing it, and threw it on the floor. Not a chip. 👍. The only thing is there are remnences of water under the cap that you can’t get out unless you unscrew it. I’ll show a pic.

reviews.reviewTitle: You get what ya pay for
reviews.reviewText: I've never written a review before, but I felt like one was necessary in this situation. I plugged this in and tested it out without anything in there- seemed legit. I put coffee beans in there to grind up...didn't work. No matter what I tried, I never got this stupid thing to work again, with or without beans in it. I unfortunately missed the return window so I couldn't even get the measly 15 bucks back. Long story short, you get what you pay for with this product.

I initially bought this because I needed something quick since I didnt realize the coffee I purchased wasnt already ground.

I've used it a good dozen times now and so far I only dislike that the grinding button is so testy. If I hold it just right I can get a continual spin on the blade but otherwise it's basically a small pulse because I keep having to push it. This is a minor complaint because initially with whole beans you need to just pulse the blade to start the process but once I've gotten them mostly ground I like to give it a good grinding to ensure a complete grind and that's where my issues arises.
I wipe it clean after every uses and store away until the next time and have had zero issues with the cord length as I grind right next to the plug.
Overall a good purchase!

The grinder worked fine. I am not a coffee aficionado, so I do not grind one pot or cup at a time. I ground up the bag and poured the grounds into an empty coffee can.

You can not grind the whole bag at once, like the big grinders in the store, but after each fill just pour the ground coffee into the can and repeat.

It has it's good and bad qualities. The good is that it's not terribly loud but I still won't use it when my roommate is asleep. It also does a good job at how fine it grinds and how quickly. The only issue I have is that sometimes I have to mess with the button to get it to work. Kind of sticks. But for the price it is worth it

I ordered this in a rush because my grinder broke and I just needed a new one right away. Well this grinder is very basic with no frills. I had to grind in two batches because it has a small capacity. I've had issues with spilling the ground coffee as well. Don't know why it spills so easily but it's no bueno.

This is an amazing little machine. Grinds beans to espresso easily. Love the power cord storage at the bottom, though had I not read the reviews first, I admit, I would have had some issues...but that is what...um....reading the instructions are all about :)
I don't have anything bad to say about it.

I used to use motar and pestle to grind my spices for the curries but it used to take forever, hence, I purchased this grinder. It grinds very smoothly with minimal noise. Cinnamon sticks, coriander seeds, peppercorns all grind very well in a few seconds to a nice powder. Happy with the purchase.

My new favorite toy. Haha! It has been used everyday since I purchased it. I love that it is compact. The cord can be wrapped up and put away all nice and tidy. Imagine someone actually took the time to design a product so the cord is not flopping all over the counter. Kudos to you Hamilton. Oh and it works fantastically.

reviews.reviewTitle: Removable cup and wrappable cord are genius!
reviews.reviewText: This is the third coffee/spice grinder I have bought and this one is my favourite so far! I love that the cup is removable so that it can be washed without water damaging the motor. I also love that the cord can be coiled in a base compartment (my first grinder broke because the cord had a wind-up mechanism, but I overwound and damaged the wiring!). It also grinds well and quickly. One tip for use: hold down the lid and cup when grinding, otherwise both the lid and cup come up a bit and grinds get into the gaps. We use this for grinding everything but coffee (spices, bread crumbs, even grains).

reviews.reviewTitle: Super helpful for that grind needed for coffee break!
reviews.reviewText: I never use beans for coffee, always buy the ground. My Mother passed away recently and I brought hers home. Tried and hers did not work. July 15-16 this was Amazon sale days and I thought I needed a new focus. Better tasting coffee, I determined I needed this grinder. Love the look, my new kitchen just finished, have been using this upstairs. Seems quiet for a short time to grind beans. I love this size, I tip it over into the filter, no spoons or extra work! I actually love this!

reviews.reviewTitle: Just started grinding and we love it!
reviews.reviewText: It's perfect for a small home that doesn't need an exact grind. We have been given some whole beans by people and this is a happy solution for that. We're now committed to doing our own grinding. It's not a perfect system as it's easy to over or under grind, but it's the best economical grinder.

Like all inexpensive blade grinders, it's tough to get a consistent grind. But it's good enough and the price is right. It's easy to make a mess until you get the hang of how to get the material out after it's been ground. Once you understand that, you won't have any spills. Power is adequate.

It's capacity leaves a bit to be desired, and sometimes grinds end up under the bowl where its a bit more difficult to clean. One flaw is that all the grinds go off to the side once ground, but this is easily fixed by shaking it side to side so it collects in the bowl. It's a tad noisy but nothing crazy. Overall not bad.

reviews.reviewTitle: Dont blend hard spices-good for coffee bean
reviews.reviewText: Do not blend hard spice. It get scratched a lot inside. I blended clove and it did blend but inner part of plastic was ruined. I thought it was difected but actually very fine but so many scratch from clove. Oh wells still using it but now i only blen coffee beens. Easy to use.
Want to waste your hard earned money then buy this coffee grinder. It didn't last more then 6 weeks and in the garbage it went!!!!!!!

The unit quit working the 2nd time I used it! It took an extremely long time just to grind down enough Beans for just a few cups of Coffee. Plus the results were lumpy on not truly even ground as they should have been. I was beyond disappointed as I have always thought that Hamilton Beach made good, quality products. They may, but not when it comes to Coffee Grinders.

I found the removable grinding chamber extremely difficult to remove. After two months it also started to make weird sounds and stop grinding. It seems like the gears got stripped somehow. Very disappointing as I'd owned the previous model for five years before that happened.

This is by far the best coffee grinder I've ever owned and used. It's easy to disassemble and clean, easy to use and it grinds the beans extremely fast, at least three times faster than the previous non-brand grinder I had. I would buy it again in a heartbeat!

I really like this product. I prefer fresh ground coffee and wanted a simple and affordable grinder. For the price it works great. It is not too loud and grinds quickly. The only reason I'm giving it 4 stars is because the product description made it sound like the power cord would automatically coil at the base. This is something I learned has to be done manually.

This doesn't grind the coffee to a fineness that I'd like. I have an espresso machine, and when I make an espresso using coffee grinded by this grinder, it always comes out watery. I would only buy this if you are going to be using the ground coffee to make regular brew.

I only make coffee at home on the weekends, and usually just two cups, so i like to grind my beans, but didn't want a big contraption taking up counter space. This little one is perfect. It does the job quick and wipes out clean even quicker.

I received it a bit damaged in the interior. See the picture attached. The removable cup had some scratches. The noise is a bit concerning, actually it sounds as it will burn out soon. I’m not satisfied with the product but returning will take longer and I really need the grinder for the coffee beans o brought from Peru. To sum up, I’ve using a grinder from Bosh and it worked much better by far.

The first time I used this coffee grinder I was impressed with how quickly and easily it worked. Just a few pulses and I have a perfect coffee grinds. It's really easy to clean as well as the blade component and cover are removed from the motor easily to be rinsed off in the sink. I'm very pleased with this purchase.

Just used it for the first time and dang it's quite ! I had a sleeping baby next to me and this didn't wake her up.
Wish it had a coarseness dial though. It can be hard to guess the fineness of the ground sometimes. But for the price, cant complain.

I bought the first one (non amazon) in Aug 2017, lasted till June 2018 when I reordered from Amazon. The last one broke in November! Key things to note-
1. Product was used sparingly (between 2-3 times a week) to grind spices
2. Never washed
3. I don't have any voltage problems as all my appliances have been working just fine

This is just a bad product, easy to use but is not durable. Don't buy it, alternatives costing $ 5-10 are much more durable.

Returned it!...after 2wks, sometimes unit wouldn't turn on when I pressed button, had to wait, click it few times. Thought maybe I put too much beans, but that wasn't it. IF it worked 100%, it would of been great. It's easy to clean & use daily.

This grinder is junk. Cheaply made. Smoked and burned up 3rd time I used it. A waste to try to get Hamilton Beach to do anything about it. Save your money and buy just about anything else and you'll have a better grinder than this one.

This coffee grinder has been used almost daily since I purchased it. I like that it grinds my beans very fine or thicker if that's how I want them. I can use this for spices too or even nuts. Power is great and it's a good size.

reviews.reviewTitle: Beast of a grinder buy quiet!
reviews.reviewText:
It only takes seconds to grind your coffee beans. This grinder is so fast in fact you will want to watch you don't grind too fine!
The motor makes very little sound for the power and speed produced. Love this grinder!

DO NOT BUY!! I received this grinder today and it has obviously been used. There were coffee grounds still inside and the outside was greasy and smudged. You can see that the button you press has been worn down. It looks like it has been used for quite a long time. I was very disappointed and think it’s crazy that this happened! Just wanted to warn anyone who was thinking about purchasing this.

Pros:
Very quiet
Cheap
Compact
Easy to clean

Cons:
Small capacity like it grinds small amount of coffee beans at a time
Coffee powder spills Everytime you tried to open

Credit: good buy overall 4/5 star

reviews.reviewTitle: Unusable after a handful of uses.
reviews.reviewText:
I bought this as a replacement for my sister, as her previous grinder stopped working (the motor just died)

This one worked fine for 6-10 uses and then the piece on the "on" switch stopped connecting with the actual grinder inside. If I take a plastic knife and insert it into the recess, the grinder powers on fine. But without the cap, it's useless.

Also the cup that holds the grounds and blade easily falls off and partially broke when I first got it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good so far, see tip on lid use and notes on minor complaint
reviews.reviewText: While it works pretty well and is a good value for the price, there are half-ground or even whole beans occasionally even with just two tablespoons of fresh beans. I use it for my Aeropress, which makes SUCH a good cup of coffee. I pulse this about 20 times to get to the grind size I like to use in the Aeropress, but I do have to watch out for the wayward bean or two that doesn't make it through the grind. I like using the top as a cup after the grinding is done. With the lid still on the unit, I flip the unit over and then remove the lid down, setting the unit upright and lidless. It's easier to transfer the grounds to my Aeropress this way! I know you can remove the cup, but I just don't do it that way. :) Overall, it's a good product so far.

My husband had purchased another one at a store and didn't like it. They only had 2 choices. This coffee grinder is quiet, has removable piece for easy cleaning, and wrap around cord. Also, nice sleek size.

Great little coffee grinder! My hand grinder broke after a few years so I decided to upgrade. This one is compact and I LOVE that the cord goes back into the bottom of the unit. It was a little hard to figure out how to clean it but the chamber comes out and can be washed. Super convenient! The noise level is good and it’s not loud. I love this grinder and hope it lasts!
Love the fact that you can take out the grinding dish. Very handy. Very useful in comparison to other grinders I've used.

I didn't use it that often -- maybe 10 times in a year? And at some point it just stopped working. I could hear the motor running, but the blade wouldn't connect with it. My basic attempts at fixing it did nothing.
little noise and easy to use. however, it's really tough to clean. if you're using it on a daily basis, you don't have to clean it everyday. if not, cleaning is really a pain in the butt.
I didn't expect this to work so sell. Grinds coffee beams literally in seconds. No fuss. Buy yours today! <--This testimonial from non paid user that really thinks the product is worthy of purchase.

I love my new toy ! It is going to be awesome to be able to enjoy a cup of coffee who's beans have been freshly ground again. I miss my rocket bullet , but this grinder is so much faster and very quiet to operate. I don't have to worry about waking up my ole man's. Lol I love this product ♡♡♡♡♡♡♡♡♡♡ I give it 10 hearts.
Fits the bill! Used it right out of the box! Works as promised. Quiet, as promised. Easy, as promised. Pulse to control grind, check. Easy clean up, check! I recommend it, check!

I love this grinder. I use it for coffee and I purchased another one to grind spices and oats in. The motor sometimes starts to smell like it may be close to burning out. I have never had one burn out on me after several months of owning them, but I know when to stop. Small kitchen appliances tend to only handle so much, as is expected with this as well. But overall, I am very happy with this coffee grinder and feel like it grinds coffee and spices pretty fine.

reviews.reviewTitle: It does its job and it does it well
reviews.reviewText: It does its job. I'm not an extreme coffee enthusiast or anything so I can't claim the eccentric qualities of this coffee grinder but the average Joe will use it just fine.

reviews.reviewTitle: Use to attack the daily grind!
reviews.reviewText:
Retractable cord keeps small device clutter free.
Easy to wipe down and clean after each use.
small base makes it easier to hold and larger bowl makes a cleaner grind.
It's perfect for us! It runs very quiet, compared to every other grinder I've ever used. After grinding, flip it upside down and the lid is now the catch cup for all the grounds.

reviews.reviewTitle: love the way this food grinder disassembles
reviews.reviewText: easy to clean and i use it for many things- mostly for grinding flax seeds which can get messy after longer use. great to be able to take it apart and wash!
It was a gift for a friend

reviews.reviewTitle: Not really happy with the quality of the plastic cover - it ...
reviews.reviewText:
Used very occasionally. The plastic cover cracked in the side within 3 months. Was able to use it using tape for around another 4 months until it broke apart in 2 pieces. Called the Warranty service. They told, it is cover under warranty but I have to pay $5.99 for shipping as they don't cover the shipping charge.
Not really happy with the quality of the plastic cover - it is really not built to grind coffee bean. I would not buy or recommend to anyone...

Excellent grinder, perfect for grinding flax seeds. 5 seconds and your done grinding 2 tablespoons of seeds.
Gonna buy another one for grinding coffee beans.
Great purchase!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great Spice Blender at a bargain price.
reviews.reviewText: I primarily use this blender for spice grinding and I can say that this is by far the best blender that I have seen. It is small and compact yet powerful to get the job done right.
I bought this grinder for my daughter whose away at college and in a small apartment. This small grinder is the perfect size for her kitchen and she loves it! Great price too.

You have to keep them dry after washing them. The grinding mechanism will freeze up and render the coffee grinder unusable!! This is my second purchase. As long as you dry everything after washing them, they should last a long time!!
Good little grinder for the price. Easy to clean. I expected it to be easier to add beans to but it’s seems to be smaller than it claims to be able to hold.
Power cord is so short, that I have to hold it up in order to use it. Otherwise, it works very well and is quiet. Wouldn't work for someone with only one good hand.
This little guy is a beast .. It works 1000 times better than expected

reviews.reviewTitle: and does the job quickly which is awesome. My last blender had an automatic setting which ...
reviews.reviewText: It's quiet, and does the job quickly which is awesome. My last blender had an automatic setting which I do miss, but this one is so fast, I don't necessarily feel as though I'm missing any time from keeping the button pressed manually.

A good value. This coffee grinder is really quieter than most that i have used, and it allows you to control the type of grind you want whether coarse or very fine. Cover tends to get caught, but with a little practice its OK. The cord tucks neatly in the bottom, which is a nice clutter reducing feature.
Small container for grinding so if you need a big batch of ground coffee you may want to look for larger capacity.
Working great so far and its pretty silent compared to by blender attachment I was using. Will give it a 5 star if it holds up over time.
Perfect, great product but I sure need a brush. First time grinding but seems like a brush is need it. I used my finger to removed some of the stuck coffee. But it works perfect

The only issue I have with this is that it's really easy to overgrind your coffee beans into powder, for those who like a stronger cup of coffee this is great, for those who don't please try to use less coffee than you normally would.
This does the trick while taking up minimal counter space. I like the fact that I can lift out the cup to move the ground coffee to the maker. The online video is what sold me.
A good grinder, it's not noisy. My beans grinder well. My only suggest is the cap, it's all plastic. I would like it in crystal.
It works great. Easy to use and clean (watch your fingers on the blades!) It would be nice if the blades could be sharpened somehow. But, either way, it does its job well and I have no complaints.

I use it for placenta encapsulation (grinding dried meat). Can't compare it to any other brands but all in all I am happy with it. I love how it comes apart to clean. You do have to hold down fairly tightly on the lid while blending or else it rises up just enough for the ground powder to start building under the edge of the lid (and then it falls out when you take the lid off).
never have issues with Hamilton beach products and this grinder is no exception. little smaller hopper so if you live alone or desire a single cup of joe, this grinder is it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works fine, poor design, low capacity
reviews.reviewText: Would not suggest grinding more than 6 cups at once. Must invert grinder to remove lid without getting grounds everywhere. Always cleaning up around it.
Use on everything from the green herbs😉 to peppercorns and coffee beans and it works great

reviews.reviewTitle: Just what I was looking for
reviews.reviewText: Nice little machine that does exactly what its supposed to do. All surprisingly quiet. The build in cable storage is a nice touch
First one I’ve purchased but my husband had owned many. Says it’s great for the price and does the job well.
Easy for all types of grinds. Easily taken apart for washing. Can use and clean for spices as well as coffee.
I just got my Hamilton beach coffee grinder today and it works well and very quiet. Grinds coffee beans very quickly. I'm a very happy customer

Either the locking in of the chamber or the snapping on of the lid (or both?) is VERY sensitive though. Sometimes we have to undo & redo 3-4 times before the grinding button works.

reviews.reviewTitle: I would not recommend this grinder
reviews.reviewText: The only thing this grinder is - is cheap. No timer on how long it grinds the beans, can't grind enough beans for a full pot of coffee. It came and I needed a coffee grinder used it but replaced it. I would not recommend this grinder.

reviews.reviewTitle: I love the way the cord wraps up and is enclosed ...
reviews.reviewText: I've used a hand grinder and a disk grinder since, this is by far my favorite. This is the second one I've owned and this is relatively quite and quick. It's also fairly easy to be neat with this. Other grinders will leave grounds all over the place but I don't have that problem with this one.

Absolutely love this product! Simply use a wet paper towel and wipe the inside of the lid and grinder to clean it. Very quick and very easy. Also, it doesn’t make a lot of noise and I can easily use it to grind nuts for pancake toppings in the morning without waking up my roommate. 10/10 would recommend this product
This is a garbage product. It died after 4 uses. It also smelled as if it overheated. What a piece of junk. I will never buy another product from this company.
Not for coffee- misleading if sold as a coffee grinder. Doesn’t do the trick in texture, size etc
Easy to figure out, EASIER to store. It is essential for simple going coffee drinkers! So cute yet efficient!

I've had several of these over the years. They are not the same as they used to be. The inside is removable, but its so difficult, its useless. Your contents go all over the room when it finally pops out. Very disapointed.
Works great for all kinds of jobs. :D Used for coffee beans and all kinds of herbs. I love it!

I used the day I got, again the next morning. Later that day I wanted to make coffee and it was dead.

I had it plugged into an outlet protector which I always do so no idea why it only worked twice.

Disappointed

I have almost one year using this product with no problems at all , every day. It s small so you can t grind more than for 2-3coffees but i like because this way i have always fresh coffee.I was sceptical about the quality being so cheap but it didn't disappoint me so far. I recommend it
I forgot to check if this was Disk voltage, but other then that does the job perfectly!

I wish the container could store/grind more beans at once. I have to fill, grind, and empty it twice to make a full pot of coffee. The cord is also short, so it would not work well if your kitchen doesn't have a counter-level outlet.
Bought another one to keep at another house. Small for storage and easy to use.

reviews.reviewTitle: Amazon has a very bad policy for returning faulty coffee grinders
reviews.reviewText: Too bad I have to give this product one star. I used it twice and the third time I tried, it was dead. Amazon's return policy was only good for one month.
Good grinder. Love the take apart to clean and the cord stow features. Won't grind to a powder for Espresso. but great for other coffee makers.

reviews.reviewTitle: One of my favorite cheap grinders
reviews.reviewText: One of my favorite cheap grinders. Works every time and let's me grind how I want with a pretty even grind.

Capacity did not seem as advertised since you can’t fill it very full without ground coffee spilling out after you remove the cover. The cord storage feature is awkward. I’d rather just wrap the card around the grinder and set it on the shelf. Difficult to pour ground contents into your coffee container without making a mess. I sent mine back.
it works good, not much noise but not completely quiet for sure, sometimes it stops grinding if you overfill it but it's just for a second. I really like it!
good cheap coffee grinder. might be a bit small for large batches but you can just grind 2 cups.
Compact and fast like - a few seconds and it’s done ! Impressive
Love this grinder. It's relatively quiet, and you can tip it upside down when done grinding because the cap acts as a cup.
A little loud for a small device if you leave is sitting on the counter but I hold it in my hand and the noise is reasonable.
First time attempting to grind a quarter cup of roast beans it died and hasn't worked since. Total Garbage.

reviews.reviewTitle: a great purchase for someone with arthritic hands who cant do ...
reviews.reviewText: a great purchase for someone with arthritic hands who cant do things easily or without pain. This was a great purchase at a low price. I will be buying another one for coffee beans.
Use it for grinding flax and chia seeds and also coffee!!!
I mistakenly bought coffee beans instead of ground coffee. The company wouldn't let me exchange it so I purchased this grinder. Quick, effective, and easy to use.
We love this product. So we got one as a gift for somebody and it came in like this. The box was damaged and we cannot close the lid. We do not recommend this seller, but the product itself is good.

reviews.reviewTitle: ... have had this for a few months and its great. No complaints
reviews.reviewText: I have had this for a few months and its great. No complaints, does the job and does it well.

Spent a long time trying to figure out which coffee grinder to get since there are so many, and the reviews are pretty similar for most. I use this to grind up coffee to use in my Keurig. Works exactly for what I need. Easy to clean with damp paper towel.
The most quiet bean grinder I’ve ever owned. Easy to clean as well.
I bought this for my hubby and he thinks it’s great
Bought this for my mother in law she loves it easy to use and easy to clean. Puts her coffee beans in there and it’s really to make coffe

reviews.reviewTitle: I love that you can wrap up the cord in the ...

I really liked this grinder until it just stopped working for no reason after only 3 weeks of use. I liked the design, I liked that that the Cord could be hidden away in the bottom, I liked the low price. I was really surprised when it just stopped working. I went to use one morning, plugged it in and nothing. Nothing happened. What a shame! Luckily it happened before my return period was past. I was able to return it for a full refund. Thank you, Amazon.

Doesn't have a bearing. Its metal on plastic and wears out the first or second time you use it. Thing still works but it screams this horrific squeal when ever it turns on due to the metal on plastic. Blade is loose too. Not worth the cheap price
I had this grinder for 5 years and finally it broke. I ordered this exact same one again since we loved the first one so much!

This is the second one of these I’ve purchased. I cook most nights of the week and use this grinder for spices all the time. The first one lasted for years and worked perfectly. Don’t waste your money on more expensive versions this is the best spice grinder I’ve ever owned.
This thing is powerful and amazing. Months later and still works like new and I use it a lot
Used the first one every few days for years. Just bought another. Works well. Doesn't burn coffee beans. Is easy to clean!
Works perfect but to much noise

Haven't used much but seems to work great for small portions.
Very compact.

Great product. Compact, easy to use, easy to maintai piece of kitchen equipment. Only thing keeping from a 5 star is that the grinder bowl takes a very long time to dry. If there were a way to disassemble it further, to fully dry it by hand, it would be an easy 5 star product.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not waking the kids with this grinder
reviews.reviewText: I replaced a long time LOUD grinder with this little guy. It works like a champ. It is much quieter than I was anticipating and the grind on the grounds are perfect. It's much easier to store due to it's size and when in use takes up very little room.
Love the cord wrap that hides awAy. I use mine to grind dried seasonings
Great for a small grinder - does a good job and grinds rather quickly. No complaints

Love this little coffee grinder. Easy to use, takes very little space, and coffee now tastes better than ever. Just like any machine it takes a few weeks to get your coffee grinds to the consistency that you like.

reviews.reviewTitle: The cup has measuring markers on it and is easily removed to pour the ground up coffee into your ...
reviews.reviewText: Quick and quiet. Grinds all the beans and evenly too. The cap slides on-no twisting. The cup has measuring markers on it and is easily removed to pour the ground up coffee into your coffee maker. The cord can be hidden away at the base.
the chopping blade was missing
Bought this grinder for my son because he accidentally purchased a bag of whole bean coffee. He said it works so good he won't be buying anything but whole beans ever again.

reviews.reviewText: I've used this grinder for coffee and flax seed and it works great! For such a reasonably priced grinder, there's no need to spend more. What I really like about this one is that grinding chamber can be taken out and washed.

I have used it three times since it arrived and it feels like it is about to break ! The grinder blades do not seem to be able to fully grind up the coffee beans ? I bought it to replace a Black & Decker Grinder Mill that I had for 10 years until I dropped it. What a mistake. I own other Hamilton Beach appliances - this is the first one that seems poorly made. Only this morning the plastic top would not sit properly on the housing and pushing the actuator button did nothing. Caveat Emptor folks !...

reviews.reviewTitle: Do not buy, waste of money

great seller and product

I owe this grinder alot of thank yous!

very quiet big time.

I'm 3 months into using this product and am happy with it: it's easy to use and clean. The only drawbacks to the product are how noisy it is (standard for a coffee grinder at its price point) and how short the cord is (about 1.5' or so).

Perfect

works great!!!!

This grinder has changed my morning coffee ritual into something I do with pleasure, rather than perpetual annoyance. I spent a long time trying to get the right grinder. I didn't want a jet engine on my counter, nor a mess. And I needed something at a very reasonable price. I have to say I'm surprised how much I love this new coffee tool. The grinding noise is at a very reasonable level, considering its function, and the grind comes out perfectly for my purposes. I love the removable cup - a huge difference from turning the whole thing upside down to get the grinds out. There's a little trick to easily getting the grind-cup in and out, and once you figure it out, it works beautifully. Now we'll see if it lasts, which it does seem well-built. If it dies, I'll repost again. If you don't hear back, it lives on.

reviews.reviewText: perfect size... works wonderful. doesn't clutter up counter space. great for small grinds or travel. I've used for other items (although probably not recommended) and it always meets or exceeds my needs. SIMPLE simple to use which means a great deal to me because i dislike anything with the slightest complexity. I would certainly recommend for any user since you don't need a science degree to remove, clean, use or replace the cover/parts. Safe for those little fingers roaming around the house since you can't make it run without the cover and a child would have to have a hand large enough to hold the device and press the button. Although I have no issues with the pressing and holding the power button i could see someone with limited dexterity or arthritis might have difficulty pressing and holding the button down for any length of time. You can't leave it to do the job you have to be there to hold the button, for these users i may tend to be an issue but it does chop very quickly. Again great for travel due to the compact size but it. weighs more than you would think, not flimsy.

I love this coffee grinder. I have been wanting a coffee grinder for some time, and trust the hamilton Beach name brand and it was priced well so I thought I would give it a try. I love that the bottom pulls out so that you can wind the cord up out of the way. Makes storage a lot easier and more compact. Another thing I like is it will grind enough coffee for a whole 12 cup coffee pot. I don't have to grind in batches. It has an easy to see fill line so I just fill to that line, push the button and grind for 20 seconds, flip it over and the coffee goes into the see through cup on the top. Take the top off and pour it right into my coffee maker. You can't get any easier than that. I am also very happy with how fine it grinds the coffee. I was able to get all of that yummy goodness out of the bean. I would highly recommend this coffee grinder and will be telling friends and family about how well it works.
