This is the best grinder I've ever had! For a little one and inexpensive, I am seriously impressed. I've had mine for about a year now and I've used this thousands of times. I grind with it every day at least a few times and it's ground everything from nuts and seeds to peppercorns. I read where someone asked if it would grind up dog food into a powder and although I've never tried it, I bet it would. I can grind almonds into almond butter with mine, literally.

I don't know why I've had such good luck with mine, compared to the other reviews on here, but mine's worked Great! Maybe in how it's used makes a difference? It only takes mine about 5 seconds to grind coffee beans and if I'm grinding nuts, I'll pulse it, let it run a few seconds, stop, let it run a few seconds, stop, and keep doing that till the nuts are the consistency I like. If I want really fine powder, I'll grind the almonds or others for maybe 10 seconds and that literally makes them into a butter. I fill up the cup too to max. I don't know if that makes a difference. I've never really tried mine with just a few seeds or such. I always fill the lid up to the line and even top it off with coffee beans since they grind up to less than max when done. Then after each use I make sure to scrape everything out too. I imagine if you let the grinds keep building up underneath the blades, it'll jam up pretty fast. I always make sure I keep mine fairly clean and besides, who wants leftover grindings with your new grindings.

Mine's going on a year, maybe more actually and still going strong. A fluke? Maybe, but I know for a fact when this one breaks, I'm going right back and buying another one of these. Should it falter, I'll try again, and should that one falter? I'll pout and start thinking that maybe I did just get lucky after all, but, until those days come, I'm sticking with Hamilton Beach's nifty little 80335. The funnest little gadget I've ever owned ^_^

(Edited in 2/23/2016 it's still going strong, used every day for all kinds of grindings; herbs, peppercorns, seeds, nuts, and, speaking of nuts, be careful because if you're grinding something such as almonds, if you don't stop this in time, you could end up with almond butter. That's the other bonus though, this is powerful enough to grind nuts into nut butter. I don't know if mine's a supermachined grinder but, this has been a rockstar in the kitchen!)

reviews.reviewTitle: Bought at walmart but review is valid
reviews.reviewText: I didn't buy this from Amazon but picked it up at Walmart less then 6 months ago. I decided to write a review while I'm looking for a new one on Amazon because this failed ALREADY. Immediate impressions were lack luster. It's loud, the motor sounded to binding up with the bearing or something because it's noise level would vary in frequency and also chatter while using it. The mechanism that holds the cup in place was difficult for my wife to untwist so shed end up using it like our old proctor one (8 years old and still works at my job) and that method makes a mess with this one. The removable container is hard to remove because there's really not a lot of grip on the sides, you have to kinda push down with your palm and twist. Which would also leave you with a ring of coffee grinds on your palm. All in all, this is a terrible grinder and expect to be shopping for a new one like me.

I am in love with this grinder! The size is perfect and it has a nice sturdy feel to it. Another great feautre is the hidden cord wrap. No more cord hanging all around. I use this grinder for more than just coffee.. I cook ofently and this grinder is absolutely perfect to grind fresh spices. Cleaning is easy as well.. I just run the seperable grinder container under soap water and the job done. The seperable grinder container makes the other electronic part not getting wet while washing.. extremely happy to have this

reviews.reviewTitle: A lot of features for such a small price
reviews.reviewText:
I needed a new coffee grinder. I mostly use it to grind spices, seeds and sugar. I only use it to grind coffee on the rare occasion that I mistakenly buy coffee beans instead of ground beans. I didn't use the grinder that often so I didn't want to spend a lot. But for my $14, I sure did get a lot.

1) The bottom pulls out to wind and store the cord. This is a great feature because typically my grinder lives in the drawer when not being used. No twist tie needed to contain the cord.

2) The blade and grinding cup is completely removable for ease of cleaning. What a neat feature!

3) It was $14!!!

I've used this grinder once and I already love it.

This is a really nice little grinder. I purchased it for grinding spices rather than coffee. It's done a great job so far with the different spices I've used in it (ceylon cinnamon sticks, whole coriander, etc.) I've even used it to pulverize eggshells to use in my garden.

It really is easy to clean. The top parts come away and reassemble quickly and simply. Since I don't use it every day I appreciate that the cord stows away neatly by winding around the base.

I'm not sure why I waited so long to get an electric spice grinder; it really is so much more convenient than the hand cranked types. Do yourself a favor and buy one if you like to cook: it's less than $20 and definitely worth every penny.

I am giving this grinder 5 stars for durability. I bought mine 6 years ago and it is still going strong! I have had to buy replacement blade assemblies because I use mine a lot, mainly for grinding spices, and I wear the blades out. I have separate blade assemblies for coffee and spices. I do not use the grinder more than once a week these days since I bought a bigger coffee grinder, but I did grind coffee in it every morning for a little over 2 years.

i hate this grinder the cup design is horrible. the button to grind it a pain. it really does not grind well either. always some random beans not ground. there is one of these at work and our cheap butts went and got something different. i threw away the one i had even though it worked.

not sure why anyone would write a good review, unless they just have not had a decent grinder. maybe it is because this is the only model available at wallymart

I bought this grinder while waiting for the Krups to be delivered from Amazon, when our old Braun finally died. I figured after the Krups arrived, this one would become my spice and flax seed grinder. Much to my surprise, I much prefer this one to the Krups. Granted, I have only been using it (daily) for a month or so, but it does a wonderful job and is so convenient! I love that the excess cord is hidden inside, and especially that the entire grinding chamber comes out. Being able to empty the ground beans directly into the coffee maker without unplugging is so much more convenient. It also makes scraping out the chamber much easier. I also find the grinder to be quieter than the Krups and the Braun - a fact my still snoozing husband appreciates! HOWEVER - if you make 12 cups of coffee in the AM, this won't be for you. I use a slightly rounded half cup of beans to make about 8-9 cups of coffee, and the chamber is large enough for this, but not much more. Just be sure to gently tap the grinder on the countertop before opening the lid to level the beans. That way you won't spill grinds everywhere!

I will update this review if the Hamilton Beach bites the dust, but so far, I really couldn't be happier.

I purchased this locally for grinding flax seed. I plan to use it for herbs as well. As other reviewers have noted, it has a very short cord, but it does stash in the bottom of the machine, which is great for storage. The removable parts make it very easy to clean.

I only use this occasionally, but have had no problems with it, and find that it can handle a good load of flax and grind it evenly without complaint.

I looked a number of places for choosing this - as an occasional user, I didn't want to spend a lot of money. As has been said many times before - you get what you pay for. This is one of the most inexpensive grinders available. I don't expect a workhorse for this price. I expect a pony. That is what I got.

I love it so far, have only used it a week. Wanted something inexpensive as an extra grinder. The box said it is quiet and that is true, much quieter than the many other brands I have had in the past. The coffee chamber is removable for pouring the ground coffee into the filter and for cleaning. I think that is unique among brands. I like the switch design which operates by pressing your fingers against it rather than pushing down with your thumb...this also keep grounds out of the mechanism. It also seems to grind the coffee faster than my other units (Krupp and Cuisinart). The lid is very clear, you can actually see whether the coffee is at the grind you want. So, for the price, if it lasts a year or two I will be satisfied. Will let you know if it does not.

reviews.reviewTitle: Love this grinder! A must have if you enjoy fresh ground coffee.
reviews.reviewText: Love love love this coffee grinder!!! The removable grinding chamber is a design long overdue! Cord storage is also designed well and... IT'S SUPER QUIET!!! It does a nice fine grind which is the way I like it! I can't wait to try it when I make a coffee spice rub for a steak to put in the smoker ! I'm drinking a delicious cup of coffee as I write this review!

I received this grinder as a gift, but I use it at work. We use this grinder every weekday - multiple times per day (at least twice). We have used it for about 5 years now and it still works perfectly - how’s that for durability! I am sure it wasn’t designed for that much use. It’s also easy to clean - much easier than the Mr. Coffee grinder at home. My only complaint is that it grinds only 8 cups worth of coffee. This is not a problem for us as we brew it with enough water for 12 cups anyway. Overall, this is an excellent coffee grinder, worth every penny that will last a very long time.

reviews.reviewTitle: Pretty bad engineering in my opinion
reviews.reviewText: Pretty bad engineering in my opinion. The coffee grinder can’t grind enough for a 12 cup pot. Even if you grind enough for a half pot, the grinds get stuck between the hopper and the lid so that there’s always little pieces of ground coffee that fall out when you open it! I do like how quiet it is but they need to fix the lid issue and size

I have a Baratza Encore grinder which took a dump, and I've had this around for a couple years as my backup. For $15 you can't go wrong. The grinds are surprisingly consistent. It doesn't get hot. It's not too loud, I can grind away at 5am and not wake anyone in the house. I honestly can't tell the difference in taste between my $130 Baratza grinder and this wally world special. There are only three pieces, only two of which require cleaning which is easy, dishwasher safe of course.

The not so good:
It's easy to clean, but the way the grind chamber is designed (outer shell/inner shell), water will get caught in between the two shells and it takes a while to dry. This will not cause any issues with getting grinds wet, but if you use it every day you can expect a little bit of moisture to be caught in between the two shells. I hand wash it for time sake, but when I put it in the dishwasher I don't have this issue if I use heated dry function.

The grind chamber could be bigger as I can only get about 5 tbsp of grind if I fill it to the max with bean. So if I make my typical 6 cups, I spend about 3 minutes grinding, washing, and re-assembling the grinder after each use. Compared to the Baratza though, it's a breeze.

The blade is affixed to the grind chamber. So expect to dump your grinds into the cap (or another dish) if you wish to precisely measure.

The benefits of this unit far outweigh the not so great things. It's been so dependable that I probably won't bother reinvesting in another burr mill grinder. I'll be buying another one, to back up this one!

I had this grinder for about a year. First the cap cracked. After buying a new cap, the motor stopped working. I use this at my place of business and it gets used 3 times a week. I have a Capresso Machine thst I use every day for the past 5 yesrs

reviews.reviewTitle: Mine only lasted about a year- BUT I slapped it a lot. So I can't blame it.
reviews.reviewText:
4 stars when it was working, but it only lasted about a year. BUT this could have been because I'd slap it every time, to dislodge the grounds. I can't blame it for quitting on me, since getting slapped every day is kind of a demotivator.

It's loud, but you can cover it with a hat or towel or something to quiet it.

Works great and super quiet. I especially like that the power cord rolls up underneath the grinder so that it can be stowed away easily. TO get the grind I want, I just pulse the button until it is perfect. I highly recommend this as a first coffee grinder for someone wanting to try grinding their own beans without breaking the bank.
For the price, you can't beat this device. If you want to grind at a very fine level then just keep the on switch pressed down. If you want a coarser grind then just grind for a few seconds.

This is definitely used! Feel so disappointed, pls refer to the photos I took right after receiving the package. You can see coffee powder at the edge(inside and outside of the chamber), stains after cleaning up, and the grinding chamber looks like being used for few times…and strong smell of coffee…the worst thing is the charger is not usable at all! The purchase experience is just terrible

reviews.reviewTitle: Piece of junk - don't waste your money
reviews.reviewText: I'm on my second one of these models. Hamilton Beach was kind enough to honor my warranty after my first one crapped out in just a few months. However, the shipping they charged for the "free" replacement was the same as buying another unit retail. That second unit has also stopped working after just a few months. I don't know about their other products, but this company makes junky coffee grinders. I had the hands-free model before these, and it did not last very long, either. What a rip-off.

reviews.reviewTitle: Is it trash or is it junk? You be the judge.
reviews.reviewText: Piece of junk!!! One part of the manufacture's product descriptions at least is very accurate; my Hamilton Beach grinder is now very quiet as it is in the trash can. I have had it about two years and the grinder bowl and lid began to crack after just a few months, I wish I had returned it then. I never ground coffee in it , only spices, and today after grinding a tablespoon of fennel seeds I was running my finger around the cup to remove the seed dust and a two inch piece of the cup just fell off. During its short life in our kitchen I never knocked it on anything and never dropped it, it just cracked and broke after two years of regular use, the Krupps grinder this replaced had lasted over 25 years and I will expect the same from the Krupps that will replace this cheap piece of trash, however as I have now reached age 66 my daughter may be responsible for confirming or denying those lofty expectations.

reviews.reviewTitle: Read the directions. Most of the low rating's ,are because of Operator Head Space , stupid people.
reviews.reviewText: Will grind about anything. One the best grinder's I 've ever used.Use it for oats, coffee, etc. regularly. Very durable. Besides my Black & Decker grinder in the shop.This food grinder is a Go at this station.

reviews.reviewTitle: The grinder when I first got it worked great, I can hide the cord and grind my ...
reviews.reviewText:
I received this and a Hamilton Beach coffee maker as a gift from my work so it was free for me but I wanted to leave my short review here.

The grinder when I first got it worked great, I can hide the cord and grind my beans no problem. Then after a month or so I noticed that it would nearly stall while I was pressing the button to grind and today in the middle of grinding a batch it completely stopped working. Luckily for me the beans were ground just enough to put in the coffee maker but it looks like I will have to get another grinder asap.

I purchased this about a year ago and although I used it mostly for grinding coffee beans (occasionally) I thought I would try it to grind nuts as well. Needless to say, the plastic part that hold the blade in place, came apart causing the plastic to grind with the nuts! Yikes! I'm buying another one and I'd like to buy one without any plastic parts on the inside blade area.

reviews.reviewTitle: Manufacturing has went down the drains!
reviews.reviewText: We bought one of these 3 years ago and it lasted 2 years! When it died we went and bought the same one because we loved it. It died in 3 days! So we exchanged it at Walmart for the same exact one. It lasted 2 months! Somewhere between 3 years ago and this year Hamilton Bay decided to cut corners on this machine. We only use it for grinding coffee and haven't changed how we do so since our first one.

Very simple and easy to use. Just throw in a small amount of the beans, cover, and grind as much as needed. I also love the removable cup inside with the measurement lines. Excellent product for the price!

I have only used this grinder 3 times for spices—coriander and cumin. I have hand washed the grinding chamber but it has 3 very obvious cracks in the plastic. I would never recommend this grinder since the replacement part (grinding chamber) costs almost as much as the complete grinder.
Got this for grinding spices, doing a great job so far. Loving it!!!!
What a piece of junk. 2 uses and it smells of burning plastic, let some smoke out the bottom, and won't ever work again. What a waste of money.

reviews.reviewTitle: sounds like loose plastic piece broke away on the inside
reviews.reviewText:
Used it twice and it broke.....sounds like loose plastic piece broke away on the inside.....bought this for an apartment. On other hand, at my house I am still using the 1988 Krups coffee grinder! Not sure if they still manufacture with same quality but it could not have been an expensive one as I was fresh out of high school when I bought it!

I would try Krups.

reviews.reviewTitle: Don't buy! MINUS 5 Star garbage product!
reviews.reviewText:
This Hamilton Beach Coffee Grinder 80335 is an absolute failure. I had to exchange it 3 times and got fed up with it. Two grinders just stopped working after a few uses. We drink coffee only occasionally.
The third one started grinding the plastic screw on the blades including the plastic ring under the blades and the sharp plastic bits were mixed in with the coffee. I'm lucky that I had seen it before making a Turkish coffee. This is a coffee grinder of very poor quality and not worth your hard earned money. I would give it a minus 5, if I could.

In the motor element there are nylon washers that burn off with continued use, the blade will become loose and then it feels like it might explode in your hand (since the blade becomes wobbly without the washers). I used it for 2 years before I found the blade to be too loose for safe grinding and finally disassembled to try and fix it. I tried to replace the washers and the very same thing happened within 1 use. I hate to say it but I am fairly certain I was brewing bits of plastic with my coffee each time I used it, bummer.
Works great.

reviews.reviewTitle: Bad design and a pain to use
reviews.reviewText:
I've only had this product for a few weeks so I can't speak to its longevity. What I can comment on is the cord-situation. I like the idea of a self storing cord. I don't like the implementation on this grinder. Because the storage area is small, the cord is short. Also, the cord is made from a rather stiff plastic so that when you try to unravel it, it wants to stay curled up. With the cord fully extended and the storage cover closed the front of the grinder is now facing away from you. Another reviewer commented on the lid being a little difficult to put on. It is kind of a pain especially with a foggy pre-coffee morning brain. Another bad design feature is that it's smaller on the bottom than the top which makes it top heavy.
What I do like about the grinder is the removable blade assembly. It can be rinsed out and turned upside down on a dish rack to air dry.
It grinds the coffee as it should - no complaints there. If not for that it would have received just one star.

*Update* - The longer I use this grinder the less I like it. It's just too much of a pain. Tired of fighting with the cord and cord cover. I'll be putting it up to use less frequently for spices and purchase another for coffee.

one of my relative bought me this spice grinder. at first i was using it barely later i was using it often. my best kitchen gadget & i absolutely love this but grinder cup broke unfortunately but still now am using it. dont know wat brand to replace this beauty?
I USE MY LITTLE GRINDER TO GRIND-UP SALBA SEED AND IT DOES A FAST AND COMPLETE JOB!

reviews.reviewTitle: You get what you pay for.
reviews.reviewText: Overall, it's a decent coffee grinder for the price. I have been using mine for a month with no major problems. I cannot speak to its overall longevity. Two main complaints: (1) the max capacity seems to be less than with other coffee grinders - I like my coffee strong and it barely grinds enough for a medium sized french press, (2) the lid often does not close easily, have to really work at it to get it to shut completely.
I purchased this and it lasted less than a year!. Total waste of time and money.
I love it, so nice design, small and easy to use

Very quiet, i thought it was going to be loud because of the coffee beans and the motor but it is surprisedly quiet. We can even use it in the morning without waking up anybody. The only thing i wasnt a fan of was the cord, not long enough for me, but it wasnt a big of a deal.
Got this as a gift from a co worker only got used once. For the fact that it didn't work the second time it was used. Very disappointed because I had just bought a large bag of expresso beans.
I found that simply removing the lid after grinding beans made a mess every time.

1) it is NOT quiet. 2) the coffee grounds somehow get under the removable cup even though I never take it off. 3) it doesn't hold enough beans for a full pot of coffee, in fact barely enough for 4-5 cups. Spend a couple more $ for a decent grinder. I plan on returning this one, save yourself a lot of hassle.
I had this grinder for about 3 months and used it for about 10 times before it broke! It worked great when it was working but not worth it at all!

reviews.reviewTitle: It's a cheap grinder, but it works for small things.
reviews.reviewText: It's a cheap coffe grinder, what do you expect?

reviews.reviewTitle: It's a nice size and top is removable but I don't think ...
reviews.reviewText: It worked for about 1 year. I had a previous grinder that I used for at least 15 years. I can't fix it -- the top part won't turn to grind the beans though the inside mechanism is still spinning. I can't locate what's broken. It's a nice size and top is removable but I don't think you should count on much use after a year. Too bad.

reviews.reviewTitle: This coffee worked fine until it just mysteriously quit on me this week
reviews.reviewText: This coffee worked fine until it just mysteriously quit on me this week. It isn't very old at all, so I'm quite disappointed with the purchase.
Portable and comfortable
Recommended

reviews.reviewTitle: this thing broke within the a week. The little ...
reviews.reviewText: this thing broke within the a week. The little piece of plastic on the part you push to operate it that pushes into the motor switch broke quickly. JUNK
Stopped working while having only grinded maybe 15 bags of coffee in it's lifespan. Junk.

reviews.reviewTitle: worked for 1 small bag of coffee and then quit working abruptly
reviews.reviewText: Worked for like 1 bag of coffee. A couple of weeks later, loaded it up, grinded 1 load, and then all the magic smoke left. Very disappointed. I'm not hard on equipment, it made no high pitched noise or indication it was having a problem, just a funny smell and then doesn't work anymore. Weak.

reviews.reviewTitle: I bought two of this coffee grinder, and both of them ends up in the trash. The plastic cup broke after couple of uses.
reviews.reviewText: I bought two of this coffee grinder, and both of them ends up in the trash. The plastic cup broke after couple of uses.
It died after about a year of moderate use. I've had other grinders last for many years.
It started grinding more slowly and smelling like electrical fire within a year. Would not recommend.

I had bought this grinder from walmart, it works twice only !
it is very fragile !! I keep use it several times. each time I found a piece of plastic with my coffee !!
its a junk
I don't recommend it

reviews.reviewTitle: Spend more to get something better
reviews.reviewText: I bought this coffee grinder literally a month ago and it died. There's a one year warranty, but you have to pay for shipping to and from the manufacturer. For the month it did work it didn't actually work well. You get what you pay for, folks.
I only used this product a few weeks until I had this problem. Every time I use it I can smell burning plastic.
As the title states, it died after three uses. I would not recommend this product to anyone. Spend the extra $5-10 on something decent.

reviews.reviewTitle: So far works great! Have had it for several months
reviews.reviewText: So far works great! Have had it for several months...

reviews.reviewTitle: ... 30 years and this one is by far the best coffee grinder I've ever had
reviews.reviewText: I've been using coffee grinders for 30 years and this one is by far the best coffee grinder I've ever had! The cord is hidden cleverly in the bottom so that it's easy to store or transport. The big reservoir allows the whole coffee beans room to move around so I don't have to hold the grinder & shake it around the entire time while it grinds to get even grind. After the coffee is ground, I can turn the large lid upside down & the deep large lid holds the grind w/o spilling when pouring the grind into my French coffee press. It's light, inexpensive, & very attractive on my kitchen counter. I highly recommend this product for those who still prefer the deep roasty taste of freshly ground coffee beans made in the traditional French coffee press as opposed to the single-cup coffee maker pods which are convenient but I don't find that coffee as delicious.

I had a chance to use this coffee grinder for a couple months at a rented house. After i left i decided to try and get a better more expensive coffee grinder, and after trying a few brands i realized that this one was the best one for small batches of coffee.

Pros:
-Easiest to clean (top and cup come off!)
-Safe no sharp edges except for the blade
-Easy to activate power switch
-Small form factor
-Grinds coffee fairly consistently
-Relatively quiet
-Cord length can be adjusted

Cons:
-Can only grind 1/2 cup of beans at a time
-Cord is not particularly long
-Styrene-acrylonitrile resin (not polycarbonate which is better) clear plastic gets scratched and dulled by older dry coffee beans, this is cosmetic and does not affect function

reviews.reviewTitle: Didn't last a year; warranty support is useless
reviews.reviewText:
Very quickly after purchase the grinder chamber became very difficult to remove for cleaning. At one point I had to use a pliers to extract it. Eventually, within the course of year and with only occasional use, the binding became so bad the blades wouldn't move at all.

Since it was still under warranty I contacted Hamilton Beach via their web site. Two weeks later they told me I was eligible for a replacement but that I would have to pay shipping and handling - which amounted to just slightly less than the cost of purchasing a new one.

In the future I will avoid Hamilton Beach products.

reviews.reviewTitle: Super quiet, easy to use, easy to clean.
reviews.reviewText: I had a previous Hamilton Beach grinder that had more features - it had different settings from coarse to fine - which mainly meant the timer ran longer for finer. I loved it, but the cap fell on the floor and cracked. I had to scotch tape it together and it required my firmly holding it in place to work. I wanted to replace it, but it's discontinued. This one is actually better. You have to press the lever on the front to activate it instead of pushing a button to grind automatically. How hard is that? It seems to have a stronger motor or blades, though. I press the button for a couple of seconds a few times and get a perfect espresso grind. Easier than pressing hard on the broken one and my guess is that over a couple of years I will have saved a few kwH of electricity. I like being green. It's much, much quieter than any coffee grinder I've ever had. Because the cap is taller, it doesn't collect a lot of coffee dust and therefore needs cleaning less often. The grinding cup is a snap to clean because it easily pops out for a quick rinse. This is a great buy. Highly recommend.

The end question w coffeemakers is: do they last? (like a Krups or Braun) Don't know about this one, but new, it: 1. Has a nice, small footprint 2. Is quieter than our previous one 3. Grinds very well & has measure demarcations 4. Has a good, functional design w hide-away retractible cable & removable canister. Have had HB brand appliances that both lasted, & didn’t last... would hate to wake up to the *sheer horror* of premature failure of this one, will update review if so. Out of the box tho’, there’s nothing not to like about this one except that you can’t really scoop out of it b/c blade takes up much of its small size - you pretty much have to pull the canister out & dump the grinds into filter basket. Great pricepoint, altho’ since ordering a cpl wks ago i notice price went up $5 (ie: 25%), making it substantially less competitive. Also note that this unit does not have “well-defined fineness settings” per description (it has none at all)

reviews.reviewTitle: Sleek design gives great grinds for gourmet coffee at home
reviews.reviewText: This coffee grinder works as well, or better, than any other electric grinder that I've every owned. It's so easy to use, and it's so easy to store. I love that the cord winds around the base. All that is needed is to pull the base away from the unit and wrap the cord, while the base stays attached. I love that the receptacle can be removed from the unit so that the entire machine doesn't have to be held while dumping the ground beans into a filter. The button can be held for 20 seconds at a time. It's easy to see through the lid to get the grind that you want. This grinds fully and evenly. There is no need to shake the machine to distribute the beans while grinding. It's a great looking coffee grinder and would look nice if left out on a kitchen counter. I am very happy with this purchase. I love to grind fresh coffee beans to get the truly best cup of coffee at home.

reviews.reviewTitle: Buy yo beans, grind' um up. brew yo jo. Yum.
reviews.reviewText: Forgive my header, I was in one of my bi-polar moods. Any hoo. As you can see by the pics, the unit is pretty easy to use. The top cover slips off totally smooth without clinching or need to 'unlock'. The actual grinding cup simply twist 1/8th of a turn and it's off. At the bottom, you pull out the chord cover to expose the power chord. Just unwind, then push the cover back in. Your going to love the fact that the grinder mill is detachable. I'm sure you always hated those coffee mills that always blaringly warned: "Do Not Immerse". We all know that if you grind your beans to a fine powder, it's going to accumulate at the bottom of the mill, and trying to clean it out sufficiently is a pain. Hamilton Beach has solved that issue for us. An interesting point to note. The actual blade shaft does not sit firmly fixed into the grinder cup. It has some 'play', or wobble, which I assume helps when ripping into harder grains and spices. You'll like this coffee grinder. The instructions/user sheet is in English, French, & Spanish.

This is the worst coffee grinder I have ever used. And that's surprising, since the other coffee grinder made by Hamilton Beach is my favorite.

With this model, the plastic cover gets jammed and it is impossible to pull of (or put on for that matter). It gets stuck every time. When you try turning or pulling it off, the ground coffee goes all over my counter or table.

Secondly, I smelled a terrible burning odor as it was grinding, and the base of the unit got hot. I wouldn't recommend this for free and I'd give it zero stars if I could.

If you want a Hamilton Beach, here is the one to get. It is WONDERFUL. It doesn't last forever - the motor will probably go after a year. But during that time you will get the best grind ever, and you can control it for coarse or fine. Here is the link:

https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B000FBYRMQ/ref=ox_sc_act_title_1?ie=UTF8&psc=1&smid=ATVPDKIKX0DER

A Hamilton Beach grinder was my first purchase when I started making my own cappuccinos at home. Loved the size. Loved the retractable power cord. Hated the noise. I would fill it with coffee beans, turn it on, and walk out of the room until it was finished grinding. I came back to a Hamilton Beach grinder after a long series of short-lived hand burr grinders and a switch to cold-brew coffee. The compact size is still the same. I miss the retractable cord, but being able to have storage space at the bottom of the base is still a huge plus. The major improvement is the motor. It's a delight to use. Quiet. Efficient. I pulse my beans until I get the grind I want and I'm all set. Glad to be back with Hamilton Beach.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not a long term product and keep children away from it if cracks appear.
reviews.reviewText:
I love the product because of its simplicity. but for some reason the polycarbonate parts get stress cracks that propagate over time (could be from over pressure molding stored energy), that eventually causes you to throw it out for fear of safety. I went into contacting the company but the replacement parts and shipping cost are more then a new product.

I figure that as long as the cracks happen over 2 years, I can have enough warning. Eventually the molder would get it right before they get a law suit for hurting someone.

reviews.reviewTitle: MINI coffee grinder only big enough for 1 person
reviews.reviewText:
The title of the product is misleading. It should say MINI coffee grinder. The description is also misleading, saying it can grind enough for a 12 cup pot of coffee. The grinder holds a very small amount of coffee beans, and is better suited for grinding spices or for enough coffee for 1 person (unless you want watery half strength coffee). My wife and I brew 8 cups each morning and I have to fill, grind, refill, grind, and even then it’s not as much as we would usually use.

That said, the noise level is very quiet and the grinder is fast, compared to our previous one. If it held 2-3x, it would be perfect for us. If I lived alone or were the only coffee drinker, it would probably work well for me.

The only other issue is that removing and replacing the canister part is a little tricky and I wouldn’t want to do it daily.

Other than the title/description and the canister removal, I would rate it 5 stars.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great grinder! Love the removable cup!
reviews.reviewText: Bought this to replace my old Hamilton Beach grinder that was still going but had a cracked lid. This one so far has worked just as well and is a tad quieter. Love the easy to push button on the front. The grinder compartment does seem a little smaller than other grinders I've owned and I find needing to fill it to the top with beans when making a full pot of coffee so need to be careful when removing the "removable" cup so not to spill the grinds. But as my old grinder, I do love the removable cup! I find the cord storage useless and a pain and not really good for every day use. So I simply don't use it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Grinds well at a great price
reviews.reviewText: We were suffering with an old grinder that wasn't really working well any more, and I made the mistake of bringing home a bag of coffee unground. I got this grinder not expecting it to be much better than the failing one, but have been pleasantly surprised to find that it does a great job. It's pretty easy to finesse just how fine the beans are ground by running the grinder longer as needed. Along with that, the button on this one is actually a lot better than the one on the old grinder. The clear top on this grinder also is a plus with being able to clearly see just how much the beans are ground. Also important to note is that this grinder was on the cheaper side, especially vs. the "premium" worn out one we currently had. Apparently, it's not an instance of getting what you pay for, at least not this time around.

reviews.reviewTitle: Absolutely awesome, just like my HB Coffee Maker.
reviews.reviewText:
Pairs well with my coffee maker by the same company, and man it's easy to clean! The bladed cup section comes out to you can easily wash it which is a huge bonus in my book. I also appreciate the safety the button design provides since I do have 4 cats and a 9 year old in the house, and one never knows what they're plotting!

My only negative (not even worth taking a star away) is that the cord is crazy short. I have to move some things around on the counter to plug it in...which is ever so slightly aggravating.

Oh and sound wise it's a but quieter than others..but you're not fooling anyone that you're actively using a grinder lol.

reviews.reviewTitle: Read ALL the reviews before you buy.
reviews.reviewText:
After a gift of whole bean coffee for christmas, my wife and I went out to buy a coffee Grinder. I've never owned one, so we looked for something that was easy to use and was a brand we recognized. We got this unit and paid $14.99 (or so.)

Perhaps the thing that impresses me the most about this is that I can leave it on the counter top. The cord winds up in the base. Let me say this again, the cord doesn't hang out and snag on everything, or get in your way, it winds up in the base! Would that all small appliances had this feature!

As for the grinding, it's perfect. I love my coffee and from the outset this unit has worked FLAWLESSLY. As for those who wrote before about units that died, let me reiterate what the instructions say: Turn on for only a few seconds at a time. I run it for 1 - 2 second bursts about 6-10 times. Someone previously said that the blades were lose. Yes, they are designed that way, they float a bit in the grinding chamber - but they work.

The lid snaps on and you press the power button which is covered by a piece on the cover. This keeps the cover on while grinding. (Again, short bursts!)

The grinding chamber is removable, and you clean it with a dry cloth. (DON'T immerse the base OR the grinding chamber! Don't even run water into it! It will get water in between the plastic form and the metal grinding area. Yes, I say this from experience!)

This is an inexpensive grinder. If it dies in a year, I'll just replace it. But if you use it properly, the motor should last much longer than that.

reviews.reviewTitle: Nice grinder for people who don't like to compromise on their morning coffee.
reviews.reviewText: Grinds very fine quickly. The cord keeper that's the base has a clever design that works well. The lid fits snugly, but it was easy to get used to how to fit it right on the first try in my before-coffee state every morning. Makes mornings a whole lot better than either stopping to buy good coffee on the way to work or grinding with my manual grinder, which I'd rather just not have coffee at all if I have to do again after having this.

Great and inexpensive grinder. The removable grinding cup is an added bonus. As an avid coffee drinker, I may recommend buying a higher quality grinder, as blade grinders will create unequal grains...this will alter the taste of your coffee and create powder which can seep through your filter. However, I bought this for spice grinding, and it does that very well.

Very poor design. Works well for grinding the coffee but they have marks on the side of the cup that are off, and due to the shallow design of the cup you can't get a spoon in it to get the ground coffee out. So we have had to flip it upside down and get the ground coffee out of the lid instead (but it is just a pain and makes a mess sometimes).

Excellent Grinder. I've used it to grind various spices such as cumin, peppercorn, cardamom, fennel seeds as well as nuts like peanuts, cashews, etc. My only gripe would be that the lid is flimsy and can break if you're not careful when handling it.

I bought this over a month ago and use it daily. I like that the length of the cord can be shortened and hidden inside the bottom of the unit. I keep it coiled up short and just hold the unit up to the wall and plug it in. That way I can put it back in the cabinet without bothering with wrapping up the cord each time. It grinds consistently. The only downside, and it's not really a downside YET, is that if you aren't careful when placing the lid on the unit, I could see it easily breaking. Just don't force the lid on, make sure it's lined up and gently put it in place.

reviews.reviewTitle: Started Smoking and smelling like burnt plastic after only a few uses.
reviews.reviewText: I had an old custom grind hamilton beach coffee grinder that lasted me a decade. It finally broke and so i figured I'd get another by the same company. What a mistake. This thing not only is TERRIBLE at grinding coffee in any consistent manner but it also started smoking and filling my kitchen with plastic smoke after only a few uses. It left me with the most irregular grind i've ever gotten. The beans were either cut into little shavings or totally intact. I held down the button for another few seconds hoping it would finally get to the intact beans.... nope. Started pouring out toxic smoke instead. Total waste of money and time.

reviews.reviewTitle: Does a good job. Breaks after a year.
reviews.reviewText:
Worked wonderfully for a little over a year then mysteriously broke.

This is the grinder that got me into coffee grinding. So if you're not sure if you want to switch from buying ground coffee to whole bean and see if you tell the difference, this is a great starter grinder. Be sure to grind in 2-3 spurts, I could even get a great coarse grind if I was being very careful.

I won't be buying this again because I'd like the motor to not go out on me on a morning I'd really like my coffee.

This is my second one, the first one lasted over 5 years and was used to grind flax seeds and nuts. I read many reviews of many grinders and found that this one had all the bells and whistles I needed at half the price of the rest. Get this one, you won't regret it. Oh and the cord wraps around the bottom on the grinder and gets closed up inside of it. This is important to me as I don't keep mine on the counter but store it after use.

reviews.reviewTitle: quiet, even, and relabile! just a bit small.
reviews.reviewText:
It works great, very quiet compare to what I had before, and so far reliable, the only negative thing I can mention is the amount of coffee you can grind is pretty small, maybe for one or two cups of coffee. I usually do 4-5 grinds at once so I will have enough for a day or two (coffee addict!).

I think this is a great starter grinder for one person coffee needs.

reviews.reviewTitle: Better than before - has now died after 6 months
reviews.reviewText:
This unit replaced a five plus year old one. This one is quieter and the cord is hidden. I grind my beans, clean with an old toothbrush and put it away till next time. There are indications on it to show the level of beans needed to make "x" number of cups. I only use it for coffee beans.
Edited 9/7/19: Grinder has now quit; less than six (6) months old. Added 9/14/19: Small plastic bushing below blades cracked in half. Bought a Cuisinart to replace!

The grinder is really quiet, i don't have any worries using it in the morning and waking the neighbors. It grinds 40g coffee quickly and it only gets 4 stars for ease of use rather than 5 because you do need to give it a shake to make sure you get an even grind, but even that might be a bit harsh. Only used it once so if it breaks i'll come back and downgrade, but very happy for the price paid.

reviews.reviewTitle: Wish the cup held a little more
reviews.reviewText: This is an EXCELLENT grinder. I wasn't really a whole bean kind of gal until I mistakenly bought a lot and couldn't return it. So, I got this and found that it was easy to use and my coffee tasted great. Only problem is that if you make a full 12-cup pot, this thing barely holds enough beans to work. If you like strong coffee, you might have to do two batches for a full pot.

reviews.reviewTitle: I love the product because I love freshly ground coffee beans ...
reviews.reviewText: I love the product because I love freshly ground coffee beans and my drip coffee maker over other types of coffee makers. I would say my only complaint is that when you open the top (which has to be tight when you grind coffee) it sticks a little and you have to wiggle it off. That may cause you to loose some of the coffee grinds on your counter so it MAY cause a mess. If you are careful, nothing will happen. I've had a previous one which I gave to a friend and it is still working, so I don't anticipate this one to quit working for a long time. Very reliable.

The grounds stick to the inside (which is normal) so I helps to shake it up and down to keep them loose enough to dump out. The lid kind of wants to pop up and off when the button is released. So, I've spilled grounds a couple times trying to turn it off before setting it down, since it's so noisy when running on the counter top. It's cheap...yeah, but they're about as simple of a machine as you can get. It's more clunky to use than my last cheap one.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great little machine for the price
reviews.reviewText:
I initially purchased one of these for myself from Walmart a few months ago after accidentally buying coffee beans instead of grounds when I wasn't paying attention at the grocery store. I considered trying to take the beans back, of course, but I also had been thinking about trying grinding my own beans for a while, so I figured I should at least see how much a basic grinder would run me. For fourteen dollars, it seemed like too good a deal to pass up, so I popped one of these babies in my cart (along with a billion other things, as is typical of a Walmart trip), and used it as soon as I got home. Spoiler alert: I LOVED IT.

It's super easy to use, and I love how easily and neatly the power cord wraps up. I bought one for my sister and one for my brother for Christmas, and they, too, fell in love. It takes up almost no room on the counter, and I have to say that freshly ground beans are noticeably better. I feared I might get lazy and go back to pre-ground bs, but now I can safely say: never again.

I was surprised at how flimsy the plastic top is. It cracked after only a few uses. I went to put the top on but did not line up the sides exactly and it immediately cracked with the slightest pressure. I also don’t like the fact that the cord has to be manually wound and it hangs out if the side more than an inch. I don’t recommend this product.

I bought this because I have the old model and its still working 4 years later, and I needed another for work. Like all coffee grinders pulsing is the way to use it, lots of people burn out the motors holding it down for a whole minute, just pulse it 2-3 seconds at a time and give it a shake up and down at the same time. Thats my trick to an even grind. This new model twists into place so it cant come out accidently when you flip it to dump the grind. Good stuff.

reviews.reviewTitle: Depends On Your Needs and Usage.....
reviews.reviewText:
I purchased this grinder for my coffee beans. The bowl is VERY small and grinds enough beans for one cup of coffee which is fine for me. But, if you're looking to make more coffee at one time then this grinder would not work. It is perfect for grinding spices.

Noise level is quiet and bowl is easy to clean.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy to use and grinds quickly
reviews.reviewText: For the price, this is a great little coffee grinder. It gets the job done and I can have fresh ground coffee daily. I enjoy that the cord is stored in the grinder and that it doesn't take up much storage or counter space. I have enjoyed many Hamilton Beach appliances and this is another one I can add to my list of good products.

it’s a coffee grinder so it’s going to be noisy but it’s quick. I didn’t like all the waste of the kcups for my bfs kurieg so when we moved in together I got him this, the reusable cups and full bean coffee from a local store. he loves it. on a sunday he’ll grind coffee for the week, put it in a container and is a set

reviews.reviewTitle: works great with a french press!!
reviews.reviewText: great little coffee bean grinder. i recently received a french press and bought some coffee beans to use with it before realizing they weren't grinds. this grinder had enough room to make grounds for a very large cup of coffee for me or two cups of coffee to share. small enough and easy to store out of the way for me to use in my dorm room. absolutely love.

I like this one, a bit noisy for the morning routine, its a year older now and still going. this is my second one, not same brand,( Bodum was other one) but a lot cheaper. will post update on this soon.
Wonderfully quiet and fast. I love the fact I can remove the cup from the main part to pour the grounds into my coffee maker.

I've been using this a lot for my flaxseeds and It's been working great.
Really easy to use and to clean, doesn't make a lot of noise.
The only thing is that the cord is a bit short, but not that inconvenient.

Click the button if this review helped you at all :)
Cup size grinder - we use for grinding eggshells for the calcium to use in the garden. Works perfect to chop down to about a table salt or smaller

Was skeptical because of price. But this thing gets used a ton and is a champ. I found a Capresso grinder in my other office and brought it in because Capresso is supposed to be so great, but I realized the Hamilton Beach grinder was quieter and quicker than the Capresso! WIN! and the cord tuck feature is really neat.

I love this thing, is amazing for what I use it for, herbs mostly, flax seed and egg shells. Only thing is the inside is hard to clean cause it says don’t immerse in water but it doesn’t come out of the thing so I just do it anyways and make sure I give it 4-5 days to completely dry out before using it again. Love this thing!! Amazing for the price

This grinder does a great job. Gets the beans finely ground like I like them very quickly. It is alot quieter than my old grinder. I really like that aspect. Only reason I did not give a 5 star is I'm concerned about longevity of the plastic lid and grind button. But I haven't had any issues so far.

reviews.reviewTitle: you add the beans and push the button for as long as you'd like, based on the grind that you prefer your ...
reviews.reviewText: I needed a coffee grinder that wouldn't take up too much space in small living quarters, so I decided on this one. It is only about as wide in diameter as a tall kitchen glass, so it fits perfectly in my cupboard. This product is very simple to use...you add the beans and push the button for as long as you'd like, based on the grind that you prefer your coffee. My favorite feature is the built in wrap around storage tunnel for the cord. It keeps tight spaces nice and organized. I'm not a fan of loose cords...

Perfect little coffee grinder. Sits right next to my coffee maker and its small enough to be on the counter but still out of thew way. Very similar to my ninja pulse. Grinds beans great! Exactly what i needed.
Love the size. compact while it fully functions as other giant grinder. cup comes out to pour ground bin when it's done which is very nice.
This thing ROCKS for the price. Wow, blown away and the cord management is awesome. We use this for grinding spices and it does a bang up job. We will definitely buy this again for the restaurant!
I use it daily and it’s easy to use. If you do like I do and use a K-cup filter you will want to dump i the grounds into a bowl to easily spoon it into the cup otherwise the blades are in the way.

It's very quiet and I can ground coffee in the morning without waking up the rest of the family. It's simple to use and grounds the coffee very quickly. A must for anyone who likes the freshest cup of joe in the morning!

This unit works just fine. I only ordered it because I couldn't afford to replace the previous one I had and have been spoiled by so I'm not as happy with this one, but it works fine and does a great job grinding the coffee and doesn't make a lot of noise.

So happy with this grinder. It’s such an improvement on our previous one (which was nearly 10years old). It’s not loud. Grinds really well. And we like how you take out the receptacle to dump grounds into coffee pot.

This is my 2nd one. The first one lasted 2 years. It was very difficult to remove the plastic container. This 2nd one has the same problem. I’ve used it once and now it is in the garage. My husband used his tools to try and get the cup/plastic container out to no avail.
This is a great grinder for coffee. I haven't tried it on anything else like marijuana but I imagine it would be a bit rough on the trichomes. For baking that might not matter though.
Motor burned out the first time I used it, replaced it with a better device from another seller. Not worth the hassle of returning, I just threw it in the garbage, where it belongs.

Works great and no problems! I was very reluctant having used a burr grinder for many years. But the last two Burr grinders I had did not last long, so I looked into this. Grinds well! Just rinse it out and let dry before next use.

Very well constructed. The cord can be wrapped up for storage, there's a safety mechanism that doesn't allow blade to spin without the top on, also surprisingly quiet. Only complaint is water can get stuck in the grinder portion. There's a note in the manual that says this can happen, and to just leave it out upside down to drain. Not enough of a problem to take a star off.
I like how simple it is to use and how quiet it is. The only issue is trying to get the ground coffee out after using it. I had to use a spoon to scrape all of it out.
This grinder works really good, I just wish it was a tad bigger. I have to grind two batches of beans if I’m making a full pot of coffee. Not a big deal, but it’s be nice to fit it all in at once.

It does exactly what I need it to do. When I was shopping for it, I was amazed at how expensive they could get but this simple inexpensive coffee grinder was the perfect purchase. Its a good convenient size too, we rarely take it off the counter but when we want to its not much bigger than a travel mug so its able to be nicely tucked away. I also love the retractable cord! 10 out of 10. For the price, if it eventually dies on me, Id gladly buy another one.

I bought this for work 4 months ago yesterday. On average we may have used it 3 times a week since then.

This morning while grinding, it stopped spinning, the base became very warm, and a burning smell began to fill the room.

At home I have a grinder I spent $25 in 2013 on and it still works.

Won't purchase again. Can't recommend.
Good value and much quieter than my last HB grinder that I had for years until I dropped and broke it.
This is our second grinder of this make and model. Very simple and inexpensive grinder that will last you a couple of years for sure with every day use.

This works well, and is quiet. I had an older version of this for 10-15 years. While this one has a space in the bottom to wrap and store the cord, the old one had a retractable cord. I do miss the retractable cord. I use this exclusively for flax seeds; it grinds them quickly, evenly, and thoroughly.
Does everything you want it to at a low price. Easy to clean too.

reviews.reviewTitle: It needs a better seal to keep the product from spilling & the ...
reviews.reviewText: Grinds well but quite a bit of dust gets outside of the cup & sticks to the bottom of the device (under the removable cup). It needs a better seal to keep the product from spilling & the cord is ridiculously short. Just a few design flaws that could easily be tweaked.
I had this grinder for six months before the switch went out - my second of this model. The first one lasted about 10 months - same problem. Don't think I'll go for a third.

I accidentally bought a package of whole beans instead of the ground and this came just in time! It works great and is Nice and compact. I also like the fact that the cord wraps up inside of the base.
Gets the job done. User friendly with small footprint: just load the beans and press the button till your desired grind. Easy clean up too! Yay to freshly ground coffee.

Follow the directions, treat it well and you'll have it a very long time. Yes some parts are plastic which will overheat, distort and break; sending your grinder to an early grave. Be kind and it will be too. My household has gone through pricey coffee grinders due to heavy hands thinking MORE IS MORE. When MORE means we're grinder-LESS.

I hide this one for my personal use #Truth and set out ground coffee for the masses.
So far, so good. Just used it once. I use it to grind flex and hemp seed. Does very well. Quiet, easy cleaning, removable. Up is the bomb. Would recommend!
Fantastic little coffee grinder. Anyone who claims that the cord is too short to not read the instructions on how to extend the cord and pull it out of its storage case.

reviews.reviewTitle: The bottom pulls out a little bit so you can wrap the cord up all nice and neat inside the grinder itself
reviews.reviewText: This is a must. We ended up buying another one for my boyfriend's mom. It takes up minimal space. The bottom pulls out a little bit so you can wrap the cord up all nice and neat inside the grinder itself. I can't stress enough the taste of freshly ground coffee!!!!

Best by far of many brands tried over the years. Bought a second as backup this time in case they drop design. Lift-out bowl a must. Keeps counter clean--problem for some brands. Beans grind deliciously! Great shelf life. Terrific price.

reviews.reviewTitle: I actually like it worked good it's not super super good but ...
reviews.reviewText: I actually like it worked good it's not super super good but Good Enough to do your thing and the price is good for that I'm happy with it I have no problem also the order come very fast thank you 😀
Brought coffee beans back from Hawaii. Drinking my coffee and enjoying Israel 'IZ' Kamakawiwo'ole, its like I never left the island. What a wonderful world.

I chose this grinder based on other reviews and tips from previous buyers. First of all I don't know how everyone seems to have so much trouble with the "small cord" pull the base down gently and WOW the cord comes out and can be stored back inside. Amazing right? I also saw where some people were having trouble getting the grounds out after grinding... I didn't find this to be a problem and did not need a spoon or gadget to do so. The grinder is so small and easy to handle and pick up, when I'm done grinding my coffee I leave the lid on, turn it upside down and give it a pulse, and the coffee grinds fall right into the top acting like a little cup and then I just pour it straight from the lid and pack it into my brew basket. I really love this grinder due to it's size and it is overall very simple to use.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good for a short term solution.
reviews.reviewText: It is small, with enough room to grind single servings or a whole pot. I got 4 months out of it before the blades stopped spinning. I'd look elsewhere for a longer lasting grinder. But, this one isn't bad for a short term solution.
I feel like it doesnt grind to a fine enough level for drip coffee makers. Maybe better for french press. Also the cup is too small.
Exactly what we needed. Quiet, small, could grind a little more fine but it is for a french press so it works better!
I use it to grind up my stevia leaves for my own sugar substitute . Works great seems powerful enough small footprint

reviews.reviewTitle: ... this grinder for about a year and it works perfect, never had any problem
reviews.reviewText: Have this grinder for about a year and it works perfect, never had any problem. Doesn't make lots of noise and grind coffee very fast.

Second unit to purchase, the old one had the lid busted when it wasn't put away right and got crushed in a drawer. A whole new unit is cheaper than the lid.

I use this for grinding spices for rubs when I'm smoking meats. Used once for coffee and worked great. Makes bottled spices into a find powder to really get deep in the meat and not just sit on the outside.
I use this grinder for spices and the pepper blends I make. It works like a charm, just don't use it for coffee after peppers. lol I like the cord management as well. Makes for easy storage.
Quality
This is the most efficient coffee grinder I've owned, and it's really quiet as well. Very pleased.

Easy to use. I grind enough for 4 or 5 cups of coffee and keep it in an airtight container. The only problem I have found is that it will still work even if the top is not fully seated on the bottom. Had quite a mess one time so now I am sure the top is on tightly.
Great little compact coffee grinder. Grinds coffee beans easily and quickly. The electrical cord keeper function is great for storage purposes. Clean up is a breeze as well.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good product that's easy to use
reviews.reviewText: This quickly and easily grinds coffee every morning. The coffee tastes better with freshly ground beans.
Works as advertised. I wanted an inexpensive grinder and this is perfect for my needs. I really like the way the cord hides in the base.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very quiet and easy to store
reviews.reviewText: We were able to grind coffee downstairs with a sleeping baby upstairs without waking her! Very easy to store with the cord wrapping feature. Works great.

reviews.reviewTitle: GRINDER WORKS GREAT WITH HERBS & SPICES!
reviews.reviewText: Absolutely excellent! Bought this for grinding herbs and spices. Works like a charm!

reviews.reviewTitle: everything gets pulverized nicely. I haven't tried this for coffee beans
reviews.reviewText: I use this for spices, dried hibiscus flower, flaxseeds...everything gets pulverized nicely. I haven't tried this for coffee beans, and I probably won't because I'm team instant coffee drinker...
Great little grinder. I have only used this for coffee so far and it does a great job. I love that it can be removed from the motor so cleaning is easy.
I bought this to grind flax seeds (a fresh source of Omega 3) and I wanted to keep them separate from my coffee grinder. Seems to work well and reliably, and the price was right.
This is quieter than the other grinders that I’ve had and I like how small it is, works great!
GREAT grinder, love the cord wrap at the bottom and it is super quiet, wow! This is perfect for my daily fresh ground Kcup needs and is small and fits in perfect, love this thing!

Great grinder! The top and bottom of the space even remove so that you can wash them and keep the grinder clean. The cord at the bottom also unwinds from the base and keeps everything compact and organized!
The best feature is removable plastic container, makes it easier to remove ground coffee, clean and reload.

Works great so far. Holds about 4 to 5 table spoons of beans. When you put the top on make sure you have it lined up correctly do not force it, the peaces are plastic and I am sure it could break. Grinds quickly and can grind fine. It is easy to clean. the plug wraps around bottom of grinder bottom piece slides up to cover it. I think the the cord could be a little longer. I like the grinder an think it will do fine.

I love this coffee grinder! I grind coffee and erythritol in it (so far). I was skeptical prior to purchase but i am glad i decided to give it a go. I especially like how i can remove the cup with the blades to wash it.
This grinded the flax seeds perfectly! I'm sure it would work for other types of beans or seeds. Easy to clean and use.
the price, and quality, very pleased with purchase so much i'm going to purchase another for another use

reviews.reviewTitle: Taking a chance with a refurbished unit

reviews.reviewTitle: Good product with a few flaws.
reviews.reviewText:
This is an OK coffee grinder. It works for basic needs.

PROS:
- Grinds coffee quickly and efficiently.
- Small footprint, takes up very little space and the cord stores nicely internally.

CONS:
- Does not grind evenly. Takes some practice to get it to work the way you want.
- Easy to overfill. You want to do it just below (rather than at) the markings otherwise it is very easy to spill out.

Overall it's a good product if you aren't too picky about how your coffee is ground.
